AF.content: to have a concept: a closed heritage (seal of guarantee [see POO p. 20 “one and the same seal” “total and intact memory”])
AF.linkedContent: to have a concept: a closed heritage (seal of guarantee [see POO p. 20 “one and the same seal” “total and intact memory”])

AF.content: archive as history of every concept, all conception
AF.linkedContent: archive as history of every concept, all conception

SPOM.content: nominalism, conceptualism, realism—routed (mis en déroute) by (A)Thing called ghost
SPOM.linkedContent: nominalism, conceptualism, realism—routed (mis en déroute) by (A)Thing called ghost

SPOM.content: introduce haunting into every construction of a concept, beginning w/ being and time; ontology opposes hauntology in a movement of exorcism, ontology is a conjuration
SPOM.linkedContent: introduce haunting into every construction of a concept, beginning w/ being and time; ontology opposes hauntology in a movement of exorcism, ontology is a conjuration

POOF.content: btwn concept/event a double bind occurs, imposes itself to be endured there, law of an aporia, undecidability, crucial disjunction btwn thinking & knowing: gift, invention
POOF.linkedContent: btwn concept/event a double bind occurs, imposes itself to be endured there, law of an aporia, undecidability, crucial disjunction btwn thinking & knowing: gift, invention

POOF.content: Heidegger’s Stimmung changes everything, beyond the concept, suspends/terrifies oppositions, where truth & untruth are together equiprimordially (gleichursprunglich) > Unheimlichkeit, lodges enemy in heart of every friend
POOF.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Stimmung changes everything, beyond the concept, suspends/terrifies oppositions, where truth & untruth are together equiprimordially (gleichursprunglich) > Unheimlichkeit, lodges enemy in heart of every friend

POOF.content: every time a concept bears the ghost of the other, the enemy the friend, the friend the enemy
POOF.linkedContent: every time a concept bears the ghost of the other, the enemy the friend, the friend the enemy

POOF.content: via Plato, no prâxis can correspond to indications contained in a léxis ——since politics is essentially a prâxis, no politics can be adequate to purity of Schmitt’s concept re: enemy > politics as that which situates very place of a concept’s inadequation to itself [?]
POOF.linkedContent: via Plato, no prâxis can correspond to indications contained in a léxis ——since politics is essentially a prâxis, no politics can be adequate to purity of Schmitt’s concept re: enemy > politics as that which situates very place of a concept’s inadequation to itself [?]

POOF.content: the 2 major questions of deconstruction: 1) history of concepts & so-called ‘textual’ hegemony 2) phallogocentrism (here qua phratrocentrism)
POOF.linkedContent: the 2 major questions of deconstruction: 1) history of concepts & so-called ‘textual’ hegemony 2) phallogocentrism (here qua phratrocentrism)

SEC.content: for convenience [re: Condillac], Derrida opposes operative concept to thematic one
SEC.linkedContent: for convenience [re: Condillac], Derrida opposes operative concept to thematic one

PP.content: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it
PP.linkedContent: excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it

VM.content: fantasy [Levinas’?] of a philosophy where contradiction of concepts subsides in displacement of concepts, a philosophy enveloped in its fundamental concepts
VM.linkedContent: fantasy [Levinas’?] of a philosophy where contradiction of concepts subsides in displacement of concepts, a philosophy enveloped in its fundamental concepts

VM.content: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same

VM.content: Levinas must pose a kind of unheard of graphics, w/in which philosophical conceptuality would be no more than a function
VM.linkedContent: Levinas must pose a kind of unheard of graphics, w/in which philosophical conceptuality would be no more than a function

VM.content: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself
VM.linkedContent: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself

VM.content: every concept presupposes Being by dissimulating it
VM.linkedContent: every concept presupposes Being by dissimulating it

VM.content: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being

VM.content: for Heidegger, concept is on the plane of ontic determination; for Levinas, it is on the plane of Being
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, concept is on the plane of ontic determination; for Levinas, it is on the plane of Being

VM.content: isn’t thought of Being thought of the other before homogenous identity of concept, asphyxiation of the same?
VM.linkedContent: isn’t thought of Being thought of the other before homogenous identity of concept, asphyxiation of the same?

VM.content: God another name of Being (name because nonconcept)? > opening of the horizon not in the horizon
VM.linkedContent: God another name of Being (name because nonconcept)? > opening of the horizon not in the horizon

VP.content: does absence of question re: starting point and pre-understanding of an operative concept translate into dogmatism? [re: Husserl]
VP.linkedContent: does absence of question re: starting point and pre-understanding of an operative concept translate into dogmatism? [re: Husserl]

VP.content: once presence in absolute infinity (unity of concept, logos, and consciousness in a voice w/out differance) appears to itself as its own death, this history is closed
VP.linkedContent: once presence in absolute infinity (unity of concept, logos, and consciousness in a voice w/out differance) appears to itself as its own death, this history is closed

PPHS.content: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > passage to conceptuality
PPHS.linkedContent: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > passage to conceptuality

PPHS.content: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being
PPHS.linkedContent: sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being

SH.content: poem, in offering itself, risks losing its time and place to the holocaustic generality of recurrence and readability of concept
SH.linkedContent: poem, in offering itself, risks losing its time and place to the holocaustic generality of recurrence and readability of concept

FWT.content: deconstruction is hyperconceptual: large-scale consumption of concepts that it produces as much as it inherits > deconstruction endures experience of limit of concept, endures this excess, loves, an ecstasy of concept—jouissance—overflowing
FWT.linkedContent: deconstruction is hyperconceptual: large-scale consumption of concepts that it produces as much as it inherits > deconstruction endures experience of limit of concept, endures this excess, loves, an ecstasy of concept—jouissance—overflowing

WM.content: concept of concept cannot not retain gesture of mastery
WM.linkedContent: concept of concept cannot not retain gesture of mastery

WM.content: Kant: Grund flows from, depends on, substance (Locke: support for accidents), not schematic but symbolic hypotyposes, expresses concept w/out direct intuitionism
WM.linkedContent: Kant: Grund flows from, depends on, substance (Locke: support for accidents), not schematic but symbolic hypotyposes, expresses concept w/out direct intuitionism

WM.content: in life sciences, which demand critique of teleological judgment, we take the metaphor for the concept, use of animistic or (technical, social, cultural) analogy [pp. 258-63 via Bachelard, use of metaphor in science]
WM.linkedContent: in life sciences, which demand critique of teleological judgment, we take the metaphor for the concept, use of animistic or (technical, social, cultural) analogy [pp. 258-63 via Bachelard, use of metaphor in science]

WM.content: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept
WM.linkedContent: by placing metaphor en abyme, Nietzsche is responsible for the need to find a new distinction than that btwn metaphor and concept

WM.content: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx
WM.linkedContent: Nietzsche takes risk of continuity btwn metaphor & concept, describes metaphorical tissue of man as spider’s web, Derrida follows web, tissu, tisser, to weave, honey bees, Marx

OS.content: “there is no chance that within the thematic of metaphysics anything might have budged” w/ respect to concept of time, from Aristotle to Hegel > founding concepts, entire system, substance, cause, etc. sufficed > one cannot interrupt, transgress, exceed “metaphysics” w/out acknowledging this powerful systematic truth
OS.linkedContent: “there is no chance that within the thematic of metaphysics anything might have budged” w/ respect to concept of time, from Aristotle to Hegel > founding concepts, entire system, substance, cause, etc. sufficed > one cannot interrupt, transgress, exceed “metaphysics” w/out acknowledging this powerful systematic truth

P.content: Kant’s “conceptual scheme” for any theory of art: rational/formal/logical vs. irrational/matter/illogical > thing as formed matter
P.linkedContent: Kant’s “conceptual scheme” for any theory of art: rational/formal/logical vs. irrational/matter/illogical > thing as formed matter

P.content: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)
P.linkedContent: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)

P.content: for Kant, no transition to pleasure/displeasure from concepts (save pure practical laws where there is interest, but not attached to judgment of taste)
P.linkedContent: for Kant, no transition to pleasure/displeasure from concepts (save pure practical laws where there is interest, but not attached to judgment of taste)

P.content: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete
P.linkedContent: concepts stitch up (recoudre), furnish supplement of adherence [re: completes incomplete gadget]; still, there’s a chiasma, w/ free beauty, la coupure n’y laisse aucune peau, aucun tissu d’adhérence: law w/out concept, w/out debt, complete because incomplete

P.content: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente
P.linkedContent: une fleur belle est toujours en ce sens une fleur absolument coupable absolument absoute [sic], innocente

P.content: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut
P.linkedContent: concept: a saturating generality—drinks up or effaces sans of pure cut

POS.content: we need to determine otherwise, the effects of ideality, meaning, reference > a “new” concept (first constituting itself) possesses “localizable effervescence in the work of nomination,” effect borrows its characteristics from opposition cause/effect & essence/appearance, w/out being reduced to them > this “fringe of irreducibility” should be analyzed
POS.linkedContent: we need to determine otherwise, the effects of ideality, meaning, reference > a “new” concept (first constituting itself) possesses “localizable effervescence in the work of nomination,” effect borrows its characteristics from opposition cause/effect & essence/appearance, w/out being reduced to them > this “fringe of irreducibility” should be analyzed

POS.content: name does not name punctual simplicity of a concept, but a system of predicates defining a concept, conceptual structure centered around given predicate [re: paleonomy]
POS.linkedContent: name does not name punctual simplicity of a concept, but a system of predicates defining a concept, conceptual structure centered around given predicate [re: paleonomy]

POS.content: spacing as not only the space, but an operation, production, genetic (generative): spacing ensures no overlap of any two concepts, no privileging of a concept
POS.linkedContent: spacing as not only the space, but an operation, production, genetic (generative): spacing ensures no overlap of any two concepts, no privileging of a concept

ROP.content: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?
ROP.linkedContent: qui, fors Dieu, a jamais créé, ce qui s’appelle créé, un concept?

ROP.content: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”
ROP.linkedContent: iterability as condition/constitution of identity, ideality, of all concepts, but also (double bind) that which resists hierarchical and binary oppositions, a quasi-concept, inconceivable concept > not confusion, approximation, but “reaffirmed exigency of analysis”

ATIA.content: [can man attribute to himself indivisible concept of being able to feign a feint? “subject of the signifier”] do we have to remind a psychoanalysis that erasure of a trace can ensure its return? sense the virtual consequences on our subject: autobiography
ATIA.linkedContent: [can man attribute to himself indivisible concept of being able to feign a feint? “subject of the signifier”] do we have to remind a psychoanalysis that erasure of a trace can ensure its return? sense the virtual consequences on our subject: autobiography

O.content: in Hegelian concept of method, self-presentation of concept (l’être auprès de soi du logos absolu) is true pre-face, essential pre-dicate of all writing
O.linkedContent: in Hegelian concept of method, self-presentation of concept (l’être auprès de soi du logos absolu) is true pre-face, essential pre-dicate of all writing

O.content: for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, necessity of preface belongs to Bildung, external necessity of concept’s self-presentation, must take time into account as the existence (Dasein) of concept [legibility]

O.content: acc. Hegel, logic has as its object the very concept of science
O.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, logic has as its object the very concept of science

O.content: tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself
O.linkedContent: tautology & heterology coupled together in speculative proposition > analytic/synthetic procedure mutually envelop each other: no more anteriority, belatedness of form, exteriority of content > concept enriches itself

O.content: concept > engenderer & consumer (jouissant) of itself, relève its preface, plunges (s’enfonce) into itself > conception of concept an autoinsemination
O.linkedContent: concept > engenderer & consumer (jouissant) of itself, relève its preface, plunges (s’enfonce) into itself > conception of concept an autoinsemination

O.content: return of theological seed to itself, dispersion working for profit of Idea, exclusion as inclusion [not Hegel’s Jew?] > la vérité qui se parle dans le cercle logocentrique, c’est le discours de ce qui revient au père
O.linkedContent: return of theological seed to itself, dispersion working for profit of Idea, exclusion as inclusion [not Hegel’s Jew?] > la vérité qui se parle dans le cercle logocentrique, c’est le discours de ce qui revient au père

O.content: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]

O.content: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept
O.linkedContent: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept

O.content: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse
O.linkedContent: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse

SW.content: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)
SW.linkedContent: culpable edging of phallus, edges of the cut, support the veil, hold it like a roof, canvas—this theoretical toilet of the phallus is the concept > phallus is the concept: can’t oppose it, nor a “sexual theory”: unless you do something different, the way you set the sail (Benjamin)

WAP.content: always something of a “mot d’ordre (slogan)” in every concept, and vice versa > GREPH won’t shrink from (ne recule-t-il pas devant) le mot d’ordre
WAP.linkedContent: always something of a “mot d’ordre (slogan)” in every concept, and vice versa > GREPH won’t shrink from (ne recule-t-il pas devant) le mot d’ordre

Gii.content: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything
Gii.linkedContent: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything

PF.content: Kamuf (un)knots alibis of the concept around the major alibi: resistance
PF.linkedContent: Kamuf (un)knots alibis of the concept around the major alibi: resistance

EJQB.content: “entre la chair trop vive de l’événement littéral et la peau froide du concept court le sens”
EJQB.linkedContent: “entre la chair trop vive de l’événement littéral et la peau froide du concept court le sens”

IW.content: Cohen: eidos ≠ logos, concept (logos) is verified through idea & its rendering of accounts
IW.linkedContent: Cohen: eidos ≠ logos, concept (logos) is verified through idea & its rendering of accounts

HST.content: “the entire contradiction” more than a dialectical one: each concept hospitable to an other that never was “its other” (dialectical contradiction): autodeconstruction in every concept undoes the grip, the violence of taking, Begriff, capture, comprendre, cum-capio ——the difference btwn extending hospitality to one’s chosen other (integratable immigrants), and a tout autre (absolute surprise, madness of the concept of hospitality, atopos)
HST.linkedContent: “the entire contradiction” more than a dialectical one: each concept hospitable to an other that never was “its other” (dialectical contradiction): autodeconstruction in every concept undoes the grip, the violence of taking, Begriff, capture, comprendre, cum-capio ——the difference btwn extending hospitality to one’s chosen other (integratable immigrants), and a tout autre (absolute surprise, madness of the concept of hospitality, atopos)

HST.content: if every concept shelters or lets itself be haunted by another concept (one that’s no longer its other), no concept remains in place
HST.linkedContent: if every concept shelters or lets itself be haunted by another concept (one that’s no longer its other), no concept remains in place

HST.content: experience, exercise of impossible hospitality: “the exemplary experience of deconstruction” > deconstruction of the concept, concept of concept, of the at-home
HST.linkedContent: experience, exercise of impossible hospitality: “the exemplary experience of deconstruction” > deconstruction of the concept, concept of concept, of the at-home

HST.content: impossibility of forgiveness must be thought onto la racine la plus radicale of its paradox—it does not resist the impossibility of what wants to be conceived in it > concept of concept undergoes l’épreuve of its essential precariousness, its finitude, its deconstructability
HST.linkedContent: impossibility of forgiveness must be thought onto la racine la plus radicale of its paradox—it does not resist the impossibility of what wants to be conceived in it > concept of concept undergoes l’épreuve of its essential precariousness, its finitude, its deconstructability

LI.content: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends
LI.linkedContent: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends

LI.content: “classical concept” as target: a tortuous, complex strategy > exploit target against itself by discovering it to be “basis” of an operation directed against itself, or discovering “in it” the cryptic reserve of something utterly different
LI.linkedContent: “classical concept” as target: a tortuous, complex strategy > exploit target against itself by discovering it to be “basis” of an operation directed against itself, or discovering “in it” the cryptic reserve of something utterly different

LI.content: every concept, every philosophical concept, that lays claim to any rigor, always implies  alternative “all or nothing” —even concept “difference of degree” (simple empiricism), concept of relativity, determined acc. “all or nothing”: difference of degree or nondifference of degree
LI.linkedContent: every concept, every philosophical concept, that lays claim to any rigor, always implies alternative “all or nothing” —even concept “difference of degree” (simple empiricism), concept of relativity, determined acc. “all or nothing”: difference of degree or nondifference of degree

LI.content: it is impossible/illegitimate to form philosophical concept outside logic “all or nothing”
LI.linkedContent: it is impossible/illegitimate to form philosophical concept outside logic “all or nothing”

LI.content: all concepts appeal to idealization, even “concept” of iterability > but it has a strange status: marks possibility/limit of idealization, thus conceptualization too
LI.linkedContent: all concepts appeal to idealization, even “concept” of iterability > but it has a strange status: marks possibility/limit of idealization, thus conceptualization too

LI.content: alogical logic of iterability: it’s an ideal concept, but also the one that marks essential & ideal limit of all pure idealization > not the concept of nonideality
LI.linkedContent: alogical logic of iterability: it’s an ideal concept, but also the one that marks essential & ideal limit of all pure idealization > not the concept of nonideality

LI.content: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once

LI.content: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept
LI.linkedContent: iterability thus a concept that renders possible the silhouette of ideality, & hence the concept, hence all distinction > marks the limit of idealization/conceptualization: “concept” or quasiconcept of concept in its conceptualizable relation to nonconcept

LI.content: “ideal concept” (i.e. rigorous concept) vs. pragmatic concept (empirically useful, provisionally convenient, constructed w/out rigor)
LI.linkedContent: “ideal concept” (i.e. rigorous concept) vs. pragmatic concept (empirically useful, provisionally convenient, constructed w/out rigor)

E.content: for Kant, sight is most noble sense, but hearing is least replaceable, most allergic to prosthesis, tolerates substitution badly, almost succeeds in resisting vicariousness: this is why the mute will never know concepts, they cannot access the universal signs
E.linkedContent: for Kant, sight is most noble sense, but hearing is least replaceable, most allergic to prosthesis, tolerates substitution badly, almost succeeds in resisting vicariousness: this is why the mute will never know concepts, they cannot access the universal signs

OG.content: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)
OG.linkedContent: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)

OG.content: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)
OG.linkedContent: that a signified must be able to “take place” in its pure intelligibility (absolute logos): the theology of the sign (perhaps this epoch, whose closure we’ve outlined, will never end)

OG.content: what I call erasure of concepts

for Saussure, signifier: sound-image, not real sound but psychic impression (what Husserl would call hylè/morphé structure, distinct from all mundane reality); for Saussure, signified: not thing but “concept” or, better yet, l’idéalité du sens
OG.linkedContent: for Saussure, signifier: sound-image, not real sound but psychic impression (what Husserl would call hylè/morphé structure, distinct from all mundane reality); for Saussure, signified: not thing but “concept” or, better yet, l’idéalité du sens

OG.content: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts
OG.linkedContent: “Hegel,” “Rousseau,” “Leibniz,” “Descartes” neither identities nor causes > name of problems > so long as closure limits our discourse: we will not have other concepts

OG.content: imagination as memory as time as pity > opens reign of law & concept: concept is Dasein [Hegel], exists as time
OG.linkedContent: imagination as memory as time as pity > opens reign of law & concept: concept is Dasein [Hegel], exists as time

OG.content: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]
OG.linkedContent: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]
